tool.name: HiCUP pipeline
tool.command:
##BOWTIE_PATH="$(whereis bowtie2 | awk '{split($0,a," "); print a[2]}')" && #set BOWTIE_PATH = '/home/joachim/miniconda2/bin/bowtie2' #set index_path = '' #if str($reference_genome.source) == "history": bowtie2-build "$reference_genome.own_file" genome && ln -s "$reference_genome.own_file" genome.fa && #set index_path = 'genome' #else: #set index_path = $reference_genome.index.fields.path #end if hicup --digest $digest --index $index_path --bowtie2 $BOWTIE_PATH $keep $temp $zip $nofill
#if $format --format $format #end if #if $threads: --threads $threads #end if #if $longest: --longest $longest #end if #for $file_pair in $input_files: $file_pair.input_first_sequence $file_pair.input_second_sequence #end for && mv hicup_filter_ditag_rejects* hicup_filter_ditag_rejects

param.name: input_first_sequence
param.label: First input sequence
param.help: The first sequence for the truncater.

param.name: input_second_sequence
param.label: Second input sequence
param.help: The second sequence for the truncater.

param.label: HiCUP digister file
param.help: The file which was created by HiCUP digister.

param.label: Data format:
param.help: Specify FASTQ format Options: Sanger, Solexa Illumina 1.0, Illumina 1.3, Illumina 1.5

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options. See `Indexes` section of help below
param.option: Use a genome from the history and build index

param.name: index
param.label: Select reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the Galaxy team

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.label: No fill
param.help: Hi-C protocol did NOT include a fill-in of sticky ends prior to ligation step and therefore FASTQ reads shall be truncated at the Hi-C restriction enzyme cut site (if present) sequence is encountered

param.label: Save all temporary files
param.help: Save intermediate files (i.e. all except summaryfiles and files generated by HiCUP Deduplicator) to history

param.label: Threads
param.help: Specify the number of threads, allowing simultaneous processing of multiple files

tool.help: The HiCUP pipeline comprises the scripts ‘hicup_truncater’, ‘hicup_mapper’, ‘hicup_filter’ and ‘hicup_deduplicator’ (‘hicup_digester generates the genome_digest file used by hicup_filter). The pipeline takes FASTQ files and generates Hi-C di-tag paired reads, aligned to a specified reference genome. The HiCUP script regulates the pipeline, executing each script in turn and passing output from one stage of the program to the next.
